symptoms.name: Joint pain (arthralgia)
symptoms.pattern: Transient, usually resolving within weeks; can be recurrent

symptoms.name: Arthritis
symptoms.pattern: Sudden onset, can involve multiple joints; may include swelling, redness, heat, and limitation of motion

physical_findings: Joint effusion (especially in knees, fingers, and wrists)

lab_values.Rubella IgG antibodies: Elevated in serum and joint aspirates

required: Clinical presentation of arthritis or arthralgia
Recent history of rubella infection or vaccination
supportive: Elevated rubella-specific IgG antibodies in serum and/or joint fluid
Detection of rubella virus RNA or isolation of rubella virus from joint fluid
